Record updated by Stacey Flatt to reflect August 2019 accretion. Materials are in English.
Fales Library and Special Collections
Food Studies Ephemera Collection
Fales Library
MSS.310
7.75 Linear Feet in 18 boxes, 2 folders in a shared manuscript box and 1 folder in a shared flat box.
1900-2015 The Food Studies Ephemera Collection consists of pamphlets, recipe booklets, and other food- and cookery-related ephemera donated to Fales by various donors. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Accruals
Further accruals are anticipated.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials gifted by various donors from 2011 to 2019. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 2011.310, 2014.412, 2015.310, 2018.094, and 2019.051.
Arrangement
The Collection is arranged alphabetically by subject, followed by subsequent accretion entries.
Custodial History
The items in the Food Studies Ephemera Collection have been donated to NYU by a number of individuals from the general public.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Food Studies Ephemera Collection; MSS 310; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Processing Information
Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2019 have not yet been recorded.
In February 2019 materials from Box 7 from accession 2015.310 were rehoused into two new archival boxes, Box 7 and Box 11. Booklets were found loose in the box upon inspection. Files were placed in archival folders and given titles.
In August 2019, the accretion material was placed in acid-free folders and boxes.
Scope and Contents
The Food Studies Ephemera Collection consists of printed ephemera (primarily pamphlets and recipe booklets) having to do with food and cookery. The bulk of the materials are from the mid-twentieth century.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Menus. Cooking, American -- History -- 20th century. Printed ephemera. Pamphlets. Food industry and trade -- United States. Recipes. Food science and technology. Calendars. Cuisinart (Firm)

Zul"Worcestershireundated"Sou - Zul"Yeastundated"Sou - Zul"Zuluundated"Sou - Zul"2015 Accretion: Cards and Postcards20151012015 Accretion: Programs2015102-42019 Accretion: Promotional Recipe Books, Pamphlets, Calendars, and Cruise Line Menu.25 Linear Feetin 2 file folders in a shared manuscript box and 1 folder in a shared flat box.1953-1999, undatedShared Fales 0255-6Shared Fales 0098
Scope and Contents
This accretion includes recipe booklets and calendars, a French cruise liner menu from 1953, and information booklet on the food of Denmark from 1962. The recipe booklets were primarily published as promotional material by companies including Oklahoma Peanut and Pecan Commissions, Oklahoma Natural Gas Company, Giroux Grenadine Syrup, and California Raisin Advisory Board. The recipe books typically contain special recipes for products such has raisins or pecans, alcohol, or for specific holidays like Christmas. This accretion also has recipe books produced by Jim Loyd's Open Line and Family Favorites, which appears to have been a radio show. The calendars are also promotional items with recipes, sponsored by the Farmers' Almanac, Argo and Kingsford, and Cuisinart, dating from the late 1970s to the 1990s.Oversize - Africanundated9Oversize - Menusundated9Oversize - Society of Restaurateurs (photo)19409
